titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: The cold continues, but there is a 'feeling' of thaw in the air. But the country is still snow shrouded

I celebrated the Holy Communion in the Chapel at 8 a.m. We numbered but 8 communicants. Before the prayer for the Church Militant I called for special prayer that God would guide & strengthen us in the new year.
We motored to Durham, & attended the morning service in the cathedral. I preached from Exodus xiv.15 "

I motored to Great Stainton, & preached at Evensong to a congregation of about 50 persons. This little parish, with a population of 156 has just been united to
with 424. The parson of the united parishes,

, is a good fellow with failing eyesight. He made some rather disconcerting blunders in reading the service. I read the lessons myself, & so avoided the disclosure of his weakness at the lectern: but I augured ill from the fact that he found it necessary to assist his eyes with a flash lamp! He was ordained in 1887, the year of my own ordination, & he has been 20 years at

. The increasing decrepitude of the aging clergy is becoming a very serious feature of the situation. In the old days there was a continual supply of young assistant curates, & these relieved the weakness of their old incumbents: but now the poor things have to go on without help & gradually one piece of parochial work is given up, & then another, until everything shrinks to the petty measure of the legal obligation. The standards of work are lowering everywhere in this diocese.
